intro: Lotononis fastigiata, commonly known as the upright lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
